abstract: A mutual fund in a different part of the bank owns about $380 million worth of insurance identical to the kind the “London whale” sold.
snippet: A mutual fund in a different part of the bank owns about $380 million worth of insurance identical to the kind the “London whale” sold.
lead_paragraph: For hedge funds that could smell blood in the water, it seemed to be an opportunity to take on JPMorgan Chase and win.

headline.main: As One JPMorgan Trader Sold Risky Contracts, Another One Bought Them

abstract: The F.B.I. opened an investigation of JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss as the company held its annual shareholder meeting in Tampa, Fla.
snippet: The F.B.I. opened an investigation of JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss as the company held its annual shareholder meeting in Tampa, Fla.
lead_paragraph: Investors and federal investigators turned up the heat on JPMorgan Chase on Tuesday, as shareholders called for pay givebacks from executives responsible for a stunning $2 billion trading loss and the Federal Bureau of Investigation opened a preliminary review of the debacle.

headline.main: F.B.I. Inquiry Adds to JPMorgan’s Woes

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess

abstract: The commentary surrounding the trading debacle at JPMorgan Chase has mostly been about the implications for banking reform. But the first question on everyone’s mind should be whether any existing laws were broken.
snippet: The commentary surrounding the trading debacle at JPMorgan Chase has mostly been about the implications for banking reform. But the first question on everyone’s mind should be whether any existing laws were broken.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Federal Bureau of Investigation are looking into JPMorgan Chase’s trading debacle — and if you think anything is going to come of that, well, I’m pretty sure that JPMorgan has some derivatives it would love to sell you.

headline.main: In Scrutiny of JPMorgan Loss, Bigger Questions Left Unanswered

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: Bruno Iksil, the so-called London whale at the center of the trading debacle, is expected to depart the bank, according to current and former colleagues.
snippet: Bruno Iksil, the so-called London whale at the center of the trading debacle, is expected to depart the bank, according to current and former colleagues.
lead_paragraph: The $2 billion trading loss at JPMorgan Chase has claimed another victim.

headline.main: ‘London Whale’ Said to Be Leaving JPMorgan

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Nelson D. Schwartz

abstract: Coty is said to have selected Bank of America Merrill Lynch and JPMorgan Chase as the lead underwriters for its initial public offering, days after the cosmetics maker withdrew its $10.7 billion takeover bid for Avon.
snippet: Coty is said to have selected Bank of America Merrill Lynch and JPMorgan Chase as the lead underwriters for its initial public offering, days after the cosmetics maker withdrew its $10.7 billion takeover bid for Avon.
lead_paragraph: Coty has selected underwriters for an initial public offering, according to people briefed on the matter, only two days after withdrawing a $10.7 billion takeover bid for Avon Products.

headline.main: Offering Is Possible Next Move For Coty

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Representative Spencer Bachus of Alabama played down the event’s significance for Wall Street and the broader economy, arguing that the loss will barely dent JPMorgan’s bottom line.
snippet: Representative Spencer Bachus of Alabama played down the event’s significance for Wall Street and the broader economy, arguing that the loss will barely dent JPMorgan’s bottom line.
lead_paragraph: The $2 billion trading loss at JPMorgan Chase has led to worries about the bank’s risk management, the danger of high-stakes trading by Wall Street and the shape of future financial regulation.

headline.main: Republican Lawmaker Questions Uproar Over JPMorgan Loss
